item.title: User Experience Designer (Lead Systems Analyst)
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
GE is an equal opportunity employer, offering a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation. As a User Experience Designer within GE’s New Media Technology team, this candidate will work with the Enterprise Systems organization to define and create best in class experiences for the company. The candidate will clearly and professionally demonstrate exposure to User Experience principles and methodologies, visual design, interaction design and showcase expertise through documented case studies, while having a strong understanding of digital, web and mobile technologies.

Responsibilities

  • Collaboratively lead user research, concept testing, and usability testing by utilizing various methodologies
  • Develop and document detailed user experience specifications
  • Able to articulate UX concepts and solutions through wireframes and prototypes of varying fidelity
  • Create compelling user interfaces through visual design esthetics and the use of typography
  • Work with Product Management to provide solutions to market requirements that are innovative and functional

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Management Information Systems, Graphic Design or a related field
  • Minimum 8 years of experience as an Interaction Designer or UI Designer
  • Minimum 4 years of experience executing high-profile web projects
  • Minimum 4 years of experience with web and mobile technologies such as: HTML5, JavaScript, AJAX, Mobile SDKs, etc.
  • Must provide a portfolio (web or PDF) clearly demonstrating the different processes of User Experience
  • Must submit your application for employment through COS (Internal Candidates) or GECareers.com (External Candidates) to be considered for this opening
  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.
  • Must be willing to work out of an office in Van Buren Township, Michigan
  • Must be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act

Benefits

  • GE strives to provide competitive employee benefits packages in the regions and industries in which we have a presence. Our wide range of employee services, retirement, health and other benefit plans are designed to help eligible employees make the best decisions for themselves, their family, and their lifestyle.

item.title: Front-End Engineer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Next Big Sound is looking for engineers to focus on front-end development. You should have a passion for shipping elegant, fast web applications that will be used by the music industry.

Responsibilities

  • Proactively look for ways to make Next Big Sound better
  • Write front-end code in PHP, HTML/CSS, and Javascript
  • Design of extraction tools using our API
  • Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from, product management, designers, and back-end engineers
  • Rapidly fix bugs and solve problems

Qualifications

  • Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance
  • Demonstrable experience building world-class, consumer web application interfaces
  • Excellent programming skills in PHP (Codeigniter), Javascript (Backbone, Underscore), CSS (Less)
  • Strong command of web standards, CSS-based design, cross-browser compatibility
  • Good understanding of web technologies (HTTP, Apache) and familiarity with Unix/Linux
  • Knowledgeable foundation in interaction design principles
  • Great written communication and documentation abilities
  • B.S. or higher in Computer science or equivalent

Benefits

  • Please contact us to learn more.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Analytics and Insights for the Music Industry

With Next Big Sound, users track mentions of their favorite bands and musical artists across a variety of major music websites: music plays on Last.fm and MySpace, fans on Facebook, iLike, Last.fm, MySpace and Twitter, band page views on MySpace, and band page comments on MySpace. NBS calculates and graphs each of these statistics over time and compares the data to that of other similar bands. The site has been tracking this data since June 2009 for over 486,000 bands. Next Big Sound was recently named as one of the 10 best music startups of 2010 by Billboard Magazine and CEO Alex White was named to Billboard's 30 Under 30 executives to watch list.

item.title: Design Technologist
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
The Amazon.com Universal Shopping Experience team (USX) is seeking a uniquely innovative and highly motivated Design Technologist (Prototyper) to bring to life bold concepts for the future of shopping. In this role, you will use a variety of tools and technologies to prototype new ways of interacting and shopping on the web and devices, with a variety of modalities. You’ll work with a small, highly capable team of designers, researchers and engineers in a studio environment, inventing and iterating on concepts that start and end with the customer. The ideal candidate will have an inventor’s spirit, an eye for detail, a can-do approach, and proficiency in a wide range of languages, platforms and technologies.

Responsibilities

  • Actively participate in concept development and design ideation as part of a small team.
  • Rapidly build and iterate prototypes that push the bounds of today’s computing to prove concepts and test ideas.
  • Develop polished, high-fidelity functional prototypes to prove and sell concepts to development teams and senior leadership.
  • Partner with engineering to ensure that interactive techniques and technologies translate through to shipping products and services.

Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or related technical field (In lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience).
  • At least 3 years’ experience as a key member of a UI design team participating in the complete product development lifecycle of successfully launched applications.
  • Proficiency in native mobile development and HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript, with a strong grasp on Object-Oriented thinking.
  • Strong interaction and rapid prototype engineering skills across a broad spectrum of technologies including: Native mobile development, e.g. Objective-C/Xcode, HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript, JS frameworks, W3C DOM methods and properties
  • Knowledge of web development tools such as Frameworks (e.g. jQuery, Backbone, Bootstrap), Package Management (e.g. Require.js, AMD), Browser Debugging (e.g. Web Inspector, Firebug, WebDev Toolbar), Templating (e.g. Handlebars, Underscore templates), and Preprocessors (e.g. SASS, LESS, CoffeeScript).
  • Strong grasp of Physics, Algebra and Calculus and experience with application and modeling, e.g. transitions, gestures, image processing, 3D, etc.
  • Portfolio of work that demonstrates detailed attention to typography, color, imagery, motion, and graphic elements
  • Preferred: Experience in fetching data from services and screen scraping using a RESTful API (e.g. Twitter, AWS, OAuth).
  • Preferred: Experience with Object Oriented JavaScript and modern JavaScript libraries (e.g., Closure, jQuery, Node).
  • Preferred: Experience with vector and motion graphics, including SVG, HTML5 Canvas, and Animation via JavaScript and CSS.
  • Preferred: Fluency in one or more of: Python/PHP/Ruby, Flash/ActionScript, C, C++ or Java.
  • Preferred: Experience with unconventional hardware and software platform. Experience with sensors integration, including basic signal processing.
  • Preferred: HCI and research experience, including mobile HCI, tangible interfaces, and physical computing.

Benefits

  • A choice of four medical plans, including prescription drug coverage, designed to meet your individual needs, with domestic partner coverage
  • Dental plan
  • Vision plan
  • Company-paid basic life and accident coverage as well as optional coverage at a low cost
  • Company-paid short- and long-term disability plan
  • Employee assistance program including dependent-care referral services and financial/legal services
  • Health-care and dependent-care flexible spending accounts
  • Salaried employees earn two weeks of vacation time in the first year, three weeks of vacation in the second
  • Hourly employees earn 40 hours of vacation time in the first year, 80 hours in the second
  • Six personal days every year in addition to six holidays
  • 401(k) savings plan with a company match
  • Several employee discount programs
  • Most Amazon employees receive Amazon Restricted Stock Units
  • Amazon may provide relocation assistance for certain positions. (Ask your interviewer whether the position is eligible for relocation assistance.)

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Sunset District, San Francisco, CA, USA
Sunset District, San Francisco, CA, USA

item.title: Product Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
The web is a giant place, and Dropbox is working to make the gap between computers and the internet much smaller. Dropbox is one of the fastest growing startups anywhere, and we're serving companies, schools, and millions of people worldwide. Dropbox is working on big problems; the kind of challenges that give you bragging rights, but we're nowhere near finished. Our greatest accomplishments are still waiting for you to build them. We've got a pretty broad vision for where we want to head next: we want to tie everyone's devices and services together to become the file system of the internet. And because we have such a small team, you'll be owning huge ideas from the start. Meanwhile, you'll join talented teammates to create something that simplifies people's lives.

Benefits & Perks

  • Set your own Dropbox storage quota
  • Free breakfast, lunch and dinner daily, plus tons of snacks and beverages
  • Office across from the SF Giants' ballpark
  • Really flexible hours
  • Eighteen days of paid vacation and eleven paid holidays
  • If you're sick, just stay home and get better
  • Subsidized gym and commuter programs, including our very own Dropbox shuttle service within San Francisco
  • 401(k)
  • Vision, dental, life, and health insurance too
  • Join the band. Complete music studio equipped with drums, P.A., amplifiers, etc...
  • Whiskey Fridays
  • Gaming! Starcraft, dedicated game rooms, DDR (yep, a real machine), ping pong, tournaments, and more

Qualifications

  • You're an experience whisperer -- you can distill complicated problems into simple and elegant solutions.
  • You have an understanding of what makes an experience good or bad -- you can think through user problems, find reasonable solutions, then mock them up in detail and work with engineers build them.
  • You love making things beautiful, and you have a strong understanding of composition, balance, symmetry, and white-space.
  • You have a highly refined aesthetic sense and can both work within and expand the 'Dropbox style'.
  • You're a self-starter who actively seeks ways to make the Dropbox experience both visually appealing and easy to use.
  • You look for opportunities to solve problems in unique and innovative ways.
  • You understand the technical limitations and liberties behind your decisions, and have enough chops to communicate your ideas to engineers.
  • You are actively involved in defining product strategy.
  • You think in terms of design systems and make rational design decisions.
  • You obsess over details, and are excited to polish until your work is pixel-perfect.
  • You have plenty of experience designing for the web, and understand how to apply both form and function within it while maintaining simplicity.
  • You're constantly pushing your limits and searching for opportunities to become better.
  • You create your own iconography, set up your own guidelines, and build easy-to-navigate documents.
  • Your team collaboration skills are unparalleled.
  • You thrive in an environment with short feedback loops.
  • You read everything and will paste an html heart character before your first name on the next page.
  • You want work on a team of the world's best software designers and engineers building a product that you use everyday!
Please include a link to your portfolio - there's a spot for it on the application page.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: South of Market, San Francisco, CA, USA

Dropbox is a file hosting service operated by Dropbox, Inc., that offers cloud storage, file synchronization, and client software. Dropbox allows users to create a special folder on each of their computers, which Dropbox then synchronizes so that it appears to be the same folder (with the same contents) regardless of which computer is used to view it. Files placed in this folder also are accessible through a website and mobile phone applications.
South of Market, San Francisco, CA, USA

item.title: UI Web Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
The least interesting thing about Wave is accounting. The most interesting thing is the energy, pace and sense of adventure working with one of Canada's hottest new companies - an award-winning tech startup with hundreds of thousands of customers around the world. We want to get even more creative and adventurous in our growth, and we're looking for a UI Designer to join our application team and help us liberate small business owners worldwide from the dark side of accounting. At Wave you will:
  • Gather requirements and develop a deep understanding about current challenges from project leads, user feedback, and application analytics
  • Work together with a small team to develop new, or optimize existing, functionality
  • Create sketches, wireframes, or prototypes to map out, visualize and test application flow
  • Deliver an engaging user experience, in terms of visual aesthetic, ease of understanding and use, and device independence
  • Measure, test, and analyze solutions to seek out areas for improvement
  • Play a pivotal role in acquiring, communicating with and retaining our awesome customers
  • Work as part of a team that's focused on continual skills improvement and helping each other learn new things
Requirements:
  • Heavy-duty prototyping and interaction design skills, either with wireframes or in working HTML/CSS/jQuery (preferably both)
  • An analytical, meticulous, detail-obsessed mindset
  • A portfolio that showcases your excellent understanding of typography, layout, colour, and general visual design principles
  • Initiative to own the process from initial concept to production-ready solution and beyond
  • Desire to work in a fast-paced, fluid environment where formal project requirements or design guidelines are not always available
  • Ability to iterate quickly and thrive in an agile workflow
  • Willingness to run solo with a project when needed, as well as switching gears to consult and collaborate with both a creative team and developers
  • Outstanding communication skills
An exceptional candidate has:
  • User research and usability testing experience
  • Experience with user interface design for mobile devices
  • Serious HTML/CSS/jQuery development experience
What makes working here awesome:
  • Great people, great culture
  • Casual and fun office environment
  • Very competitive compensation, including stock options.
  • Benefits
  • Vibrant neighbourhood
  • An incredible opportunity to get in on the ground floor of one of Canada’s startup darlings, experiencing lightning-fast growth and international recognition
Learn more about who we are and what Wave has accomplished so far.

item.title: Graphic Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Murphy-Hoffman Company (MHC) is North America’s largest Kenworth truck dealership group. As MHC continues to grow, we have an opening for a Graphic Designer at our Corporate Office in Leawood, KS location. The role of the Graphic Designer is to support the Marketing Department with graphic design services for advertising, promotional and e-marketing campaigns to support the sales organization and strategic priorities. This position will translate business needs into designs that capture the desired corporate identity, brand awareness and marketing image. This individual would have the opportunity to:
Job Responsibilities:
Branding & Advertising: Provide graphic design services for web and other media, including print, intranet, presentations, and marketing collateral materials. Sales Support & Education: Develop and support marketing programs designed to enhance the sales process. This includes printed materials, sales tools, presentations and e-marketing campaigns. Direct Marketing & Lead Generation: Support the creative direction and development of specific marketing campaigns to encourage customer interaction for MHC department and companies. This includes printed materials, e-marketing, landing pages, search engine campaigns and other social media outlets. Website: Maintain and update content on company website and create landing pages to support marketing campaigns. SharePoint: Provide support and help maintain the site pages for Marketing and other Departments. Administrative: Assists Brand & Communication Manager/Director with regular department maintenance projects: File organization Electronic file archives and back-ups Purchasing coordination and vendor communication Budget adherence Project status reports Ideal Candidate Would Possess:
Undergraduate degree in Graphic Design or the equivalent combination of training and experience. One to three years of relevant work experience in Graphic Design preferred. Proficient with computer skills with the following systems and software: Microsoft Windows; Microsoft Office Suite; Microsoft SharePoint; Macintosh/PC, Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator and Flash; and HTML/DHTML. Must have a strong commitment to customer service. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be a team player with a positive, can do attitude. Our Benefits Include:
Competitive Salary Medical, Dental and Prescription Insurance Disability and Life Insurance Paid Time Off program 401k and Profit Sharing with Employer Match Flexible Spending Account Internal Promotion Opportunities Tuition Reimbursement Program On the Job Training

item.title: Interactive Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
DEG is currently looking for a highly motivated creative professional to join our Interactive Design team to assist in the development of digital user-centered design for a wide range of clients. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, organized and can think critically and creatively to solve problems. It is important that this individual possess effective written, verbal and visual communication skills.
The successful candidate will have demonstrated knowledge in best practices across multiple interactive platforms including email, social media, web design, ecommerce and mobile. This is a unique opportunity to make both our clients and our internal teams look and feel excellent. DEG provides the opportunity to work on national brands in a truly integrated and digital-specific capacity. Our highly entrepreneurial, collaborative, and dynamic environment is the perfect place for smart, motivated people to make an impact. With competitive benefits and a dedication to work-life balance, we are also a great place to work.
Responsibilities
Create engaging interface design concepts for high traffic multi-national corporations Interact with clients in a professional setting to determine project requirements Analyze existing web interfaces for usability and user experience issues Develop wireframes, moodboards/storyboards and concepts Clearly articulate creative rationale Design decisions and processes Work closely with copywriters, UX, engineering and UI developers to ensure seamless execution of designs Established commitment to the timely and accurate delivery of projects
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design or related field Proven strength in visual design and interactive design with at least 2-3 years of professional experience or similar and an online portfolio to prove it Experience interacting directly with clients Demonstrated knowledge in best practices across multiple interactive platforms including email, social media, web design, ecommerce and mobile Organizational skills that facilitate multi-tasking, collaborative team-first approach, the use of sound judgment and the ability to independently prioritize work load Possess deep knowledge of Adobe CS and related design tools. Experience with HTML/CSS and animation a plus
Please send online portfolio for consideration.

item.title: Web Designer / Front End Developer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
The web designer will be responsible for the day-to-day site design and creation. Will keep www.gfsionline.com up to date with daily/weekly updates from Brand Teams & Art Teams. This will allow each sales rep to quickly find the necessary Sales/Marketing Tools and download to their iPad, laptop or home computer for presentation purposes. Responsible for redesign/update of www.gearforsports.com, which will involve seasonal updates. Join Scene 7 Team to help develop a new garment image library with internal & external access.
The Web Designer is responsible for the development and design of major and minor Web applications and components for the internal and external system users. The developer will design, develop, test and deliver web sites, applications and components. Enhancements and defect resolution will be required on an ongoing basis. Best practices and design methods will be utilized to insure the success of the projects.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities Creating or editing images and graphics for website use Creating templates of approved website layout Make changes to the site directed by client Verify functionality of website Assist in meetings with divisional Brand Teams to implements files into new website Work with Creative Leads to implements files into new website Developing/Managing new websites: www.gfsionline.com, www.gearforsports.com, Follett, Barnes & Noble, etc. Competencies Regularly demonstrates GEAR Vision and Values Complies with GEAR attendance policies Observes safety and security procedures Effective oral, written and verbal communication skills Demonstrates dependability by following instructions and responding to management direction and takes responsibility for own actions Demonstrates quality by being accurate and thorough; Continues to look for ways to improve and promote quality Completes projects correctly and on time Ability to listen closely to the client and create pages that reflect what the client is looking for Work well under pressure of tight deadlines and changing demands Physical Demands While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear; to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; and to use hands and arms to reach, handle and operate objects, tools, controls and equipment. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, stoop or crouch.
Work Environment Works in well lighted, air conditioned/heated office environment
Minimum Qualifications Six months experience working in Wordpress, HTML and Javascript Familiar with issues of browser / server compatibility Experience in developing websites and / or web applications

item.title: Graphic Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
The Gerson Companies is comprised of two divisions - Gerson Everyday branded product lines and a seasonal product line called Gerson International Limited or GIL. The Gerson Everyday branded product lines include: The GG Collection, Lone Elm Studios, Everlasting Glow® Flameless Candles, Lanterns, and Globes, Everlasting Glow® LED Lighted Branches and Light Strings, and Universal SunRay. In our GIL seasonal product line we design, import and distribute two complete lines of seasonal merchandise (Fall/Christmas and Spring/Summer) that are pre-booked with retailers six months in advance. We pre-sell then manufacture what we sold. This keeps our inventory lean with few mark-ups, so we can offer you the lowest prices. Our in-house design team focuses on art driven products, accessories, seasonal, and decor based in Olathe, Kansas is looking for a photographer / graphic designer who enjoys a fast-paced and creative environment. As a core member of the team she/he will play an active role in developing innovative design concepts and photographic images and executing brand-friendly solutions for web, products, and print.
The candidate's portfolio should demonstrate a keen aesthetic with strong skills in photography, typography, color, and layout with a solid knowledge of intuitive user experiences. Like the rest of the team, she or he should love art, design, fashion, the internet, and social media. Lighting and general knowledge of photo studio set-up needed.
The Job
Develop creative, visual product imagery combining beautiful product photography and typography for web and print projects. Deliver high-quality photography and graphic design under tight deadlines. Lead efforts to optimize images for website that enhances user experience, creating wireframes and specifications as needed. Maintain integrity of brand, including identity, color palette and typography, when extending brand across a broad range of design solutions, including packaging and many different products. Assist and lead new product creations and design. Work closely with the principals in creating marketing solutions for new products. The Person We're Looking For
Has a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in photography/ graphic/web design. Expert knowledge in graphic applications including Photoshop, Aperture/Lightroom, Illustrator, InDesign, CS6, etc. Expert knowledge and experience with photo editing and lighting for product photography. Has an online portfolio that demonstrates strong, versatile product photography and design experience within a creative team, understanding of grid systems, composition, and color with a keen eye for typography, and meticulous attention to detail. Is flexible and able to work accurately in a fast-paced environment. Hours may be extensive in certain seasons and some travel may be discussed as the department grows. Has the experience and ability to produce and coordinate off site photo shoots with products and models. Is curious! And continually keeps up-to-date on interactive and design trends, as well as technical skills. Is self motivated and can work both independently and in a team environment. Videography and video editing experience a nice addition Great verbal and written communications skills. Illustration ability is a big plus. Product / Photo Studio prop and set design experience. A sense of humor and flexibility. Has strong understanding of the art/design community and is an artist in their own right.

item.title: Graphic/Web Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded: Conceptualizes, designs, and produces print and interactive campaigns for promotion of our client’s brand, products and services. Identifies, conceptualizes and produces designs in the appropriate formats to deliver our client’s message and reach their specific audience. Experience in creating logos, identity packages, publication layouts, ads, brochures, flyers, and flat mock up web site designs. Experience producing high quality design deliverables into all of the industry’s required formats. Experience in writing and manipulating basic website coding such as HTML and CSS. Experience with CMS (content management systems such as Joomla and WordPress) installation, updating, installing extensions, migrating from one host to another. Creating slide shows, photo galleries, and embedding multimedia applications. Experience in phone and email support, maintenance and updating web site content per client specification. Associates or bachelors degree in graphic arts, multimedia arts, and/or web design. Minimum 1-2 years increasingly responsible experience as a graphic designer and web designer. Minimum 3-5 years experience with industry-standard graphics applications including the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Flash, Dream Weaver, Acrobat) school experience counts here.

item.title: Senior Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
The Sr. Multimedia Communications Designer will serve as a project manager, designer and driver of design/visual communications strategy to effectively communicate team initiatives, product launches and events. In this role, the Sr. Multimedia Communications Designer will be highly creative in order to engage external and internal audiences, extend communications messages, and promote Disney Interactive’s suite of games, online properties, apps and digital experiences. Creative responsibilities include, but are not limited to: presentations, asset management, website development, print mockups, promotional collateral, event deliverables, email communications, graphics, logo design and asset creation, intranet design, and management, and video production.

Qualifications

  • Concept and produce digital media for communication initiatives (presentations, templates, digital signage, graphics, logos, etc.)
  • Drive design strategy and vision based on the project needs and direction from the project lead.
  • Lead creative development and execution of deliverables (on multiple platforms) for both external and internal audiences.
  • Generate new and innovative executive presentations that include sound and video production.
  • Design full-scale event creative that extends from signage to promo items.
  • Manage all design projects, communicating, strategizing and prioritizing with product teams as needed.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Disney Interactive Studios, Inc. (initially Walt Disney Computer Software, later Disney Interactive and Buena Vista Games, Inc.) is a Worldwide American video game company. It self-publishes and distributes multi-platform video games and interactive entertainment worldwide. Disney Interactive Studios is a subsidiary of Disney Interactive, thus a part of the The Walt Disney Company media conglomerate.

item.title: Graphic Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Foursquare is building a world class sales organization with a mission of reinventing the way marketers connect with consumers at a hyper local level. Our Graphic Designer on the National Sales team will act as a one-person, internal creative services team and sit at the intersection of technology, design and brand building to help our team sell ideas through design thinking.
Your career path may be non-linear, but the underlying theme has been applying design to solve abstract business problems. You understand how to break down a brief and can create a visual solution for almost any challenge. You are ready to apply yourself to building a revenue stream for Foursquare and will be comfortable working with teams ranging from Sales, Operations, Account Management, Product and Data Analytics. You relish the chance to pitch your work to clients and are comfortable with on-the-fly brainstorming. You will pivot daily between ideation, presentation development, content development, writing, designing and thinking about ways to proactively grow revenue.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Concept, design and implement creative solutions in multiple formats to build revenue channels
  • Interface with key Monetization team constituencies to provide a creative and design counter perspective to strategic business discussions
  • Outbound presentation, product overviews and RFP design elements
  • Brainstorming with Account Executives to help bring ideas to brands who want to work with Foursquare
  • Fielding inbound requests with little warning on tight timelines
  • General problem solving

Requirements:

  • 3-5 years of experience in design, creative development, UX/UI design or a similar field with a portfolio to represent your work
  • Mastery of Keynote, Photoshop, In-Design & Illustrator (After Effects is a plus)
  • A portfolio that reflects projects on which you were the sole or lead designer, as well as projects on which you supported a lead designer
  • Ability to prioritize in an environment where everything is a priority
  • Ability to function as a brand ambassador with senior clients and marketers
  • Comfortable with aggressive revenue targets and a willingness to find new ad opportunities with existing industry relationships
This position is based in our New York City headquarters in SoHo. We offer competitive compensation packages, including full benefits and equity for all employees.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Mission District, San Francisco, CA, USA

Foursquare helps you and your friends make the most of where you are. We're a small but highly ambitious company with millions of users worldwide relying on foursquare to keep up with friends, discover what's nearby, save money and unlock deals. We’re also helping over a million registered merchants ranging from local businesses to global brands connect with their customers. To thrive as a member of team Foursquare, you must embrace our exciting work-hard, play-hard environment. We're not afraid to move fast and break things as we release, launch, iterate, update and announce -- sometimes all in the same day. We're a closely-knit team and, especially at the end of a long day over beers, we feel like we're inventing the future together.
Mission District, San Francisco, CA, USA

item.title: Web Designer / Developer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Page Design Group is a full-service design studio based in Sacramento, California. We provide everything from web design, to packaging, to print design and everything in-between. Our regional client base ranges from small startups to large corporations and public agencies. We have great clients and a position open for someone who can contribute in a creative and positive manner to our in-house web design team. What We’re Looking For A Swiss Army Knife Our clients have a variety of differing needs. Therefore, the 14-member staff at Page Design Group has to match those requests with a variety of skill sets. We have a hard time saying no to most requests - however varied they may be. That is what set us apart and kept clients coming back for more. You will need to be able to contribute to these requests as much as possible. A Communicator You need to be able to have responsive and professional interactions with clients and other staff members (email, phone, face-to-face.). We work very closely with our clients so fresh breath, good note-taking and communication skills are also critical to this position. A Collaborator Page Design Group lives in a collaborative and open space, where we harbor a positive spirit within our talented staff. This makes the final product better, and both customers and designers happier. There will always be support to help you, as well as opportunities for back and forth sharing of ideas, design, and code. You will need to be comfortable explaining your ideas, and willing to move on if a different direction has been given. Skills/Qualifications
  • You need tohave a good eye for visual layout and graphic design
  • Competent in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign
  • Ability to hand-code a site with semantic HTML5 and CSS3
  • 2+ years experience in web design and development
  • CMS experience (Wordpress, Drupal etc.)
  • Some back-end development experience (PHP, MySQL, etc.)
  • Javascript skills (using plugins or even writing your own functions and plugins)
Nice to have
  • Basic Studio Photography skills (working with strobes and digital equipment).
  • Animation and editing skills (Comfortable with After Effects, Flash, and Final Cut)
  • Some basic networking and IT experience
  • Version Control experience (we use Git, but experience with any other system is good)
We look forward to hearing from you and seeing how you can contribute to this fun and challenging environment, set in the heart of the sunny central valley of Northern California.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Full-service graphic design for print and web

item.title: UX Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Fab exists for one simple reason: To make you smile! It’s more than just a tagline. It’s the way we work. Fab is the place to discover the most exciting things for your life. Our modern, urban-inspired products allow everyone to design their lives and express their personal sense of style. Always unique, well-designed, and of the highest quality. At Fab, our employees are just as unique as our products! We are always looking for super smart, innovative, and of course quirky, individuals to join our expanding global team. Fab is seeking a world-class talent to join the Fab User Experience team in our NYC office. This position will report to Fab’s SVP of UX and work closely with Fab’s CEO to further evolve the Fab user experience. Who you are:
  • You think broadly and push forward independently. You are comfortable single-handedly taking a concept from a one sentence idea to a robust experience ready for release.
  • You are an amazing user experience designer and have a fantastic eye for graphic design.
  • You understand pixel perfection and why it’s critical.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced mentality. We ship code every day. We are constantly challenging ourselves to push the boundaries of e-commerce.
Key areas you will build, own and be accountable for:
  • Conceptualize, define and execute new user-facing new products and features. Define use cases, user flows, and experience feature requirements
  • Interface with web & mobile developers to ensure experiences are implemented as intended.
  • Make our users smile. Take ownership of ensuring that the Fab UX stays Fab as we introduce new features and products at a rapid pace, and that we are delivering smiles with every release.
What you must do to be considered:
  • Conduct a review of Fab’s current user experience across web and mobile.
  • Present a list of 3 to 5 new features or improvements to the Fab UX you would work on immediately. Please have at least one recommendation each for web and mobile.
  • Provide wireframes/mockups for one of the ideas you propose.
  • Give examples of user experiences that you personally led and/or designed
What you should bring to the table:
  • 2+ years experience in user experience and/or consumer product management
  • Strong understanding of user-centric design methodologies and processes
  • Deep understanding of web & mobile UX standards, technology trends, and industry trends
  • Willingness to learn quickly, adapt, and thrive in a fast paced, rapid release environment.
  • Experience working in an entrepreneurial/start up environment is prefered.
  • Ability to make it fun.

item.title: API Engineer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Meetup is looking for an API Engineer to help millions of people around the world find their people. The Meetup API allows members and organizers to write software extensions to their local community. Photography Meetups use the API to create photo browsers tailored to their needs, large outdoor groups have built their own platform to keep their members active, and data scientists consume and analyze public Meetup’s public data streams. In addition to the global Meetup community’s interaction with our API, over a quarter of members use our native apps to find and connect with communities that matter to them. This activity flows directly through the API platform, and you will work most closely with Meetup’s mobile team to enable richer experiences for members. The Meetup backend is a hybrid JVM stack including Scala, Python, and Java. New API methods are implemented in Unfiltered, and as an engineer on the API team you’ll bring your ideas to life primarily in Scala. An ideal candidate has:
  • Extensive experience programming HTTP networked systems.
  • A solid background in Scala and working knowledge of Python and Java.
  • A passion for good API design and performance.
  • Experience with relational databases and understanding of SQL.
  • Attention to detail and a feeling of pride and ownership over quality.
Our team is smart, ambitious, and supportive — above all, we are excited by what we do. While meeting regular deadlines and being focused on quick, quality completion of projects, the environment is relaxed and fun. If the above describes you and your passions, we’d love to hear from you!

item.title: Senior UX Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
We are seeking an experienced and enthusiastic designer to join our growing UX team and play a vital role in shaping a world-class user experience for over 26 million households on the internet. As a Senior User Experience Designer at Synacor, you will work closely with Product and Engineering teams in crafting next generation web experiences across a variety of platforms and devices. You will apply user-centered design methods to translate user needs, business objectives and technology capabilities into world-class experiences.
Responsibilities:
  • Design world-class consumer experiences (UI designs, interaction models, prototypes, etc.) in a fast-paced, agile, startup-like environment
  • Create high-end visual interfaces for consumer facing web experiences and applications while adhering to best practice and trending visual standards
  • Gain knowledge of the business requirements of our clients and translate them into user experiences
  • Communicate and document design specifications and concepts
  • Create wireframes, visual concepts and interactive prototypes to describe the user experience and interaction models
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams and collaborate with product managers, developers, and designers to define and achieve product objectives.
  • Develop and provide thought leadership in the architecture and user experience for features and products across multiple devices.
  • Consider and leverage all available insights including market analysis, customer feedback, site metrics, and usability findings in all design activities.
Qualifications:
  • 5+ years experience creating large-scale digital interfaces for consumer-facing web applications
  • Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Expertise with Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Working knowledge of HTML, xHTML, CSS and web standards
  • BA/BS in design-related discipline preferred
  • Experience designing for multiple device platforms
***In order to be considered for this role, please submit a portfolio with your application.***

item.title: Front End Developer - Digital Arts
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Do you want to make software that matters to millions?
Autodesk’s Advanced Consumer Group is looking for a Front End Web Developer that cares as much about technology as they do for the user experience. The Digital Arts team in Toronto has big plans for expanding the Pixlr and Sketchbook product lines onto the web. You'll be helping to create Digital Arts products like SketchBook and Pixlr which have loyal, creative and passionate users who expect solid, robust and elegant products.
Job title and REQ#: Front End Developer - Digital Arts / REQ13WD14451 Location: Toronto, ON
What you’ll be doing: Build apps that allow the next generation of digital artists to shine and show off Find out where the interactive web is going next Speak to an audience of millions Listen and respond when they tell you what’s wrong Pushing yourself, have the drive to build award winning software Work closely with designers to come up with compelling interactions Build creative web apps that will be used as professional utilities, where users spend hours working and expect not to lose even a second of that work Participate in a collaborative environment with a cross-functional team Build with APIs and shareable functionality in mind Build out functionality that balances both the user experience and performance Maintain existing platforms and applications (Don’t worry, we have cool existing tech) Define our new Stack
What you’ve done: Developed a healthy sense of humour 4-5 years work on large scale internet applications Degree in computer engineering / science or equivalent work experience Experience creating high-performance, cross-browser client-side code that is robust, scalable, and cacheable Relational, Document and Key / Value databases Web infrastructure, distributed systems and third party service integration Understood the engineering aspects of software development (unit testing, continuous integration, cross-browser compatibility, code reviews, design docs) Experience with server and client side development Thrived in an agile, iterative, things-will-change-often environment Benchmarked, debugged and profiled applications LAMP stack
What you’ve picked up: HTML & JavaScript Flash / Air or Silverlight or jQuery Git and Github MySQL, MongoDB Memcached, Redis Node.js C++ or Java or C# Node.js and Express AWS or Linode
Would be nice if you knew: WebGL Scala, GO, HaskellOther types of app development (desktop, mobile, embedded)

item.title: Website Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
We are currently searching for a talented and enthusiastic graphic design professional to join our team. 9th sphere is looking for someone who is innovative, determined and drives for success in everything he/she does. A professional, honest and detail oriented individual is required.

PREFERRED SKILLS:

  • Disciplined, organized & reliable work habits
  • Detail & quality driven
  • Creative & innovative
  • Internet savvy

item.title: Web Developer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Your middle name is ‘digital’ and you’re an unbelievably savvy front-end web designer. You understand that user experience means user engagement and you know exactly the right tools to make it meaningful. And, you get that your mission is to work with our creative team to bring great ideas to life. You don’t care if your client is selling cat food or spaceships… you’ll always apply best-in-class HTML5, CSS3, XML, XHTML, CMS, responsive design, JavaScript, PHP, MySQL, Adobe, Photoshop and API integrations to solutions - both big and small.
You have been honing your web development and design skills for at least three to five years now in a marketing agency environment, after learning your craft at one of the best college programs. Your understanding of how to effectively use social media tools like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube is demonstrated by your work portfolio, as is your understanding that a tablet is not something that you swallow. Websites you build are found on the top of search rankings, as your super hero costume says “THE Optimizer’.
You’ve set yourself a high bar for client satisfaction through ongoing personal development, exemplary teamwork, incredible organization skills, diverse and current technical knowledge and a ‘no challenge is too much’ attitude, to help your clients win.
Our Company
5th business® is a Canadian-based marketing strategy and communications company that delivers great ideas that build business for our domestic and international category-leading clients in the B2B, B2C, and not-for-profit sectors. We are located near the Toronto Pearson International Airport.
Our Environment
We’ve put a clear marker in the ground and are aggressively heading towards it. We’re looking for people who want to build something with us. And not just any something… something truly great. And in doing so, you’ll be rewarded with recognition, advancement opportunity and finance.
We LOVE star performers, creative thinkers and hard workers, balanced with a great sense of humour and sense of fun.
We welcome applications from qualified candidates. Simply email your resume and cover letter in MS Word or PDF format.
Thank you for your interest in 5th business — all resumes will be carefully reviewed, and we will contact those candidates selected for interview based on our specific criteria.
No phone calls or employment agencies, please.

item.title: Web Designer
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded: You are an experienced web and graphic designer who lives and breathes creative digital design. You love the internet and create eye-popping visuals that engage consumers with brands and drive them to buy. You balance design with understanding of HTML/CSS so you can manage your design flow from start to finish. You work well with others in an off-site roll and want to work with a dynamic, exciting company where you can grow and contribute to the long-term value. Key Responsibilities • Effectively interpret project needs and translate them into compelling visual designs • Design campaign assets that create emotional connections to consumers • Provide fashion focused art direction for consumer facing marketing materials • Contribute to the design of web interfaces using techniques based on usability theory and concepts related to creating visual flow • Effectively communicate design direction and production details for other members of the team. • Apply your deep understanding of typography, usability, storyboarding and iconography when working on web projects • Work within project schedules and within tight deadlines • Collaborate with other designers & business owners to ensure your designs are consistent with expectations and overall project goals • Stay current on visual design techniques and technology to expand the company’s reputation as a leader in online retail Characteristics of a Successful Candidate: • A mind-blowing portfolio of your design work • You are adept at relevant design software particularly Photoshop, Illustrator • Experience applying theories related to color schemes, use of space, text placement, usability and visual flow • Understands and is able to create content specification and design guidelines • Strong communication and problem solving skills and the ability to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment Attributes: • Sense of humor • Demonstrates a commitment to bringing in new sources of creative inspiration to your work and team and will be driven to enhance your creative and technical skills • An understanding of the marriage between design freedom and business requirements • Loves to learn • Takes ownership of tasks and drives tasks through to completion • Positive and constructive • Able to focus while under pressure

item.title: Art Director
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
Now seeking: Dreamers. In marketing communications, we dream it and create it. All of the company’s promotional and communication needs are completed in-house by these “creatives” in an advertising agency-based set-up. This includes everything from advertising, promotions and print production to media relations, exhibition coordination and website maintenance. Everyone from artists, writers, designers, media buyers, event coordinators, video producers/editors and public relations specialists work together to bring campaigns and product-centric promotions to life. If you’re a dreamer, gather up your portfolio and show us your vision.Garmin is adding one more enthusiastic individual to our in-house Communications team. We are looking for a full-time Art Director for our headquarters in Olathe, Kansas. In this role you will provide visual communications talents in the development of print and interactive advertising, collateral, in-store and event materials and other marketing materials; handling projects from concept to layout &design, to final production. Key responsibilities also include: - Meet with appropriate teammates to identify and define project parameters - Develop and visualize multiple concepts for any given project - Finalize concepts into finished comps for presentation, reviews and approvals - Outsource appropriate resources to supply finished goods. Define and provide specifications for production and obtain documented cost estimates for processing and approval - Provide direction on photo and video shoots - Produce final artwork and incorporate into final layouts
Qualifications
A High School Diploma or GED and minimum of 5 years creative experience in a graphic design studio or advertising ad agency environment is required. Qualified candidates for this role will possess the following education, experience and skills: - Demonstrated proficiency using Mac OS and utilizing the Adobe Creative suite, including InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator - A portfolio demonstrating exceptional understanding and use of concept and design - Demonstrated knowledge in the application of pre-press production methods and final production follow through - Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills - Must be team-oriented, possess a positive attitude and work well with others - Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a flexible, fast paced and challenging environment - Must be detail-oriented and have the ability to work proactively and effectively Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree in Visual Communication, Graphic Design, Web Design, Advertising or related field preferred. At Garmin, we like to laugh, have fun and work hard. It comes easily when you work on leading-edge products with hard-working individuals who share the same passion. We offer numerous opportunities to get involved (kickball anyone?) and believe strongly in a work-life balance so your creativity can flow. Garmin offers one of the most comprehensive compensation and benefit plans around. We offer extensive health care coverage with little to no contributions, depending on the plan. Plus, we offer dental insurance, an employee stock purchase plan, a Retirement Plan, and much more… trust us, it doesn’t get much better than this. Unless of course, you want to talk table tennis, fitness spaces, product discounts… come on, what are you waiting for? Apply today. EEO/AA

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
This Privacy Policy governs the manner in which Jobify collects, uses, maintains and discloses information collected from users (each, a "User") of the website ("Site"). This privacy policy applies to the Site and all products and services offered by Jobify. Personal identification information We may collect personal identification information from Users in a variety of ways, including, but not limited to, when Users visit our site, register on the site, place an order, subscribe to the newsletter, fill out a form, and in connection with other activities, services, features or resources we make available on our Site. Users may be asked for, as appropriate, name, email address, mailing address, phone number. Users may, however, visit our Site anonymously. We will collect personal identification information from Users only if they voluntarily submit such information to us. Users can always refuse to supply personally identification information, except that it may prevent them from engaging in certain Site related activities. Non-personal identification information We may collect non-personal identification information about Users whenever they interact with our Site. Non-personal identification information may include the browser name, the type of computer and technical information about Users means of connection to our Site, such as the operating system and the Internet service providers utilized and other similar information. Web browser cookies Our Site may use "cookies" to enhance User experience. User's web browser places cookies on their hard drive for record-keeping purposes and sometimes to track information about them. User may choose to set their web browser to refuse cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent. If they do so, note that some parts of the Site may not function properly. How we use collected information Jobify may collect and use Users personal information for the following purposes:
  • - To improve customer service Information you provide helps us respond to your customer service requests and support needs more efficiently.
  • - To personalize user experience We may use information in the aggregate to understand how our Users as a group use the services and resources provided on our Site.
  • - To process payments We may use the information Users provide about themselves when placing an order only to provide service to that order. We do not share this information with outside parties except to the extent necessary to provide the service.
  • - To run a promotion, contest, survey or other Site feature To send Users information they agreed to receive about topics we think will be of interest to them.
  • - To send periodic emails We may use the email address to send them information and updates pertaining to their order. If User decides to opt-in to our mailing list, they will receive emails that may include company news, updates, related product or service information, etc. If at any time the User would like to unsubscribe from receiving future emails, we include detailed unsubscribe instructions at the bottom of each email.
How we protect your information We adopt appropriate data collection, storage and processing practices and security measures to protect against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure or destruction of your personal information, username, password, transaction information and data stored on our Site. Sensitive and private data exchange between the Site and its Users happens over a SSL secured communication channel and is encrypted and protected with digital signatures. Our Site is also in compliance with PCI vulnerability standards in order to create as secure of an environment as possible for Users. Sharing your personal information We do not sell, trade, or rent Users personal identification information to others. We may share generic aggregated demographic information not linked to any personal identification information regarding visitors and users with our business partners, trusted affiliates and advertisers for the purposes outlined above. Third party websites Users may find advertising or other content on our Site that link to the sites and services of our partners, suppliers, advertisers, sponsors, licensors and other third parties. We do not control the content or links that appear on these sites and are not responsible for the practices employed by websites linked to or from our Site. In addition, these sites or services, including their content and links, may be constantly changing. These sites and services may have their own privacy policies and customer service policies. Browsing and interaction on any other website, including websites which have a link to our Site, is subject to that website's own terms and policies. Google Adsense Some of the ads may be served by Google. Google's use of the DART cookie enables it to serve ads to Users based on their visit to our Site and other sites on the Internet. DART uses "non personally identifiable information" and does NOT track personal information about you, such as your name, email address, physical address, etc. You may opt out of the use of the DART cookie by visiting the Google ad and content network privacy policy at http://www.google.com/privacy_ads.html Changes to this privacy policy Jobify has the discretion to update this privacy policy at any time. When we do, we will post a notification on the main page of our Site and send you an email. We encourage Users to frequently check this page for any changes to stay informed about how we are helping to protect the personal information we collect. You acknowledge and agree that it is your responsibility to review this privacy policy periodically and become aware of modifications. Your acceptance of these terms By using this Site, you signify your acceptance of this policy. If you do not agree to this policy, please do not use our Site. Your continued use of the Site following the posting of changes to this policy will be deemed your acceptance of those changes. Contacting us If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, the practices of this site, or your dealings with this site, please contact us at: Jobify Inc. 555 Madison Avenue, Suite F-2 Manhattan, New York 10282 1800 555 5555

item.title: FAQ
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
What is a dummy text?

A dummy text is a text which looks like a particular language at first sight and which also has some aspects in common, but which doesn't make any sense.

Who needs dummy texts?

Designer at work who don't have any content for their product yet have the possibility to insert a dummy text into their design to judge on the arrangement of text on their site, on readability or on fonts and sizes. A dummy text is also helpful to present a design without content to a client to show how the text is going to look like without irritating the client by real texts.

Why another dummy text generator?

SO far, there were only generators for "Lorem ipsum" (a dummy text in latin) and some other languages, but there were only few European ones. For European and American designers, who probably would like to use dummy texts in their own language, we developed a generator for many European languages. On top of that it's possible to upload your own language.

Why doesn't the generator put as many characters as I told him?

In order not to stint the last word, this word is being finished. Then a full stop is added to make the text as real as possible.

What means "Print special chars as HTML entities"?

If you are writing HTML and you don't use a programm which does this for you, you should replace "ä", "ü" and und "ö" by "ä", "ü" and "ö", because it's possible that these characters are sometimes not displayed correctly. If "Print special chars as HTML entities" is checked, those special characters like the German umlauts are automatically changed to HTML entities (the strings with the & and the ;).

What is a template?

Templates are texts in particular language, which the generator needs to analyse the language and to create dummy texts. There are default templates we supplied but you are also able to upload your own ones.

Why is a template text recommended to be as long as possible?

To analyse the language well, the generator needs a long text in the particular language. So he's able to identify the language characteristics better and the dummy text is more authentic.

Why should I upload own templates?

If you need other languages than the default ones, you can look for a text in that language, paste it into the text field or save and upload it. Then you're able to create dummy texts of any length in that language. Of course, we are delighted in each new language for our generator.

item.title: Canada adds 12,500 jobs in modest July rebound
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
A job is a regular activity performed in exchange for payment. A person usually begins a job by becoming an employee, volunteering, or starting a business. The duration of a job may range from an hour (in the case of odd jobs) to a lifetime (in the case of some judges). If a person is trained for a certain type of job, they may have a profession. The series of jobs a person holds in their life is their career. Jobs for people Generally people spend a good portion of their time doing a regular occupation. Some exceptions are being a student, disabled, retired or being/working in a creative field.

Types of job

There are a variety of jobs: full time, part time, temporary, odd jobs, seasonal, self-employment. People may have a chosen occupation for which they have received training or a degree. Those who do not hold down a steady job may do odd jobs or be unemployed. Moonlighting is the practice of holding an additional job or jobs, often at night, in addition to one's main job, usually to earn extra income. A person who moonlights may have little time left for sleep or leisure activities.

Day job

The expression day job is often used for a job one works in to make ends meet while performing low-paying (or non-paying) work in their preferred vocation. Archetypical examples of this are the woman who works as a waitress (her day job) while she tries to become an actress, and the professional athlete who works as a laborer in the off season because he is currently only able to make the roster of a semi-professional team. While many people do hold a full-time occupation, "day job" specifically refers to those who hold the position solely to pay living expenses so they can pursue, through low paying entry work, the job they really want (which may also be during the day). The phrase strongly implies that the day job would be quit, if only the real vocation paid a living wage. Notable figures who had day jobs include the Wright brothers, who held full-time employment as bicycle repairmen while they experimented on powered flights. The phrase "don't quit your day job" is a humorous response to a poor or mediocre performance not up to professional caliber. The phrase implies that the performer is not talented enough in that activity to be able to make a career out of it. Getting a job Further information: Job hunting and Employment Getting a first job is an important rite of passage in many cultures. Youth may start by doing household work, odd jobs, or working for a family business. In many countries, school children get summer jobs during the longer summer vacation. Students enrolled in higher education can apply for internships. Résumés summarize a person's education and job experience for potential employers. Employers read job candidate résumés to decide who to interview for an open position.

Use of the word

Labourers often talk of "getting a job", or "having a job". This conceptual metaphor of a "job" as a possession has led to its use in slogans such as "money for jobs, not bombs". Similar conceptions are that of "land" as a possession (real estate) or intellectual rights as a possession (intellectual property). The Online Etymology Dictionary explains that the origin of "job" is from the obsolete phrase "jobbe of work" in the sense of "piece of work", and most dictionaries list the Middle English "gobbe" meaning "lump" (gob) as the origin of "jobbe". Attempts to link the word to the biblical character Job seem to be folk etymology

item.title: Do you have a job that the average person doesn't even know exists?
item.dc:creator: 4366wpczar
item.content:encoded:
A job is a regular activity performed in exchange for payment. A person usually begins a job by becoming an employee, volunteering, or starting a business. The duration of a job may range from an hour (in the case of odd jobs) to a lifetime (in the case of some judges). If a person is trained for a certain type of job, they may have a profession. The series of jobs a person holds in their life is their career. Jobs for people Generally people spend a good portion of their time doing a regular occupation. Some exceptions are being a student, disabled, retired or being/working in a creative field.

Types of job

There are a variety of jobs: full time, part time, temporary, odd jobs, seasonal, self-employment. People may have a chosen occupation for which they have received training or a degree. Those who do not hold down a steady job may do odd jobs or be unemployed. Moonlighting is the practice of holding an additional job or jobs, often at night, in addition to one's main job, usually to earn extra income. A person who moonlights may have little time left for sleep or leisure activities.

Day job

The expression day job is often used for a job one works in to make ends meet while performing low-paying (or non-paying) work in their preferred vocation. Archetypical examples of this are the woman who works as a waitress (her day job) while she tries to become an actress, and the professional athlete who works as a laborer in the off season because he is currently only able to make the roster of a semi-professional team. While many people do hold a full-time occupation, "day job" specifically refers to those who hold the position solely to pay living expenses so they can pursue, through low paying entry work, the job they really want (which may also be during the day). The phrase strongly implies that the day job would be quit, if only the real vocation paid a living wage. Notable figures who had day jobs include the Wright brothers, who held full-time employment as bicycle repairmen while they experimented on powered flights. The phrase "don't quit your day job" is a humorous response to a poor or mediocre performance not up to professional caliber. The phrase implies that the performer is not talented enough in that activity to be able to make a career out of it. Getting a job Further information: Job hunting and Employment Getting a first job is an important rite of passage in many cultures. Employers read job candidate résumés to decide who to interview for an open position.

Use of the word

Similar conceptions are that of "land" as a possession (real estate) or intellectual rights as a possession (intellectual property). The Online Etymology Dictionary explains that the origin of "job" is from the obsolete phrase "jobbe of work" in the sense of "piece of work", and most dictionaries list the Middle English "gobbe" meaning "lump" (gob) as the origin of "jobbe". Attempts to link the word to the biblical character Job seem to be folk etymology
